comment: Great lectures, funny. Just beware there are only 5 grades and one can make the difference between an A and B, which I found unfair.

An amazing professor that I would definitely take again. she took her time explaining her material really well. Her exams are not lock down browser and she only has 3 exams that are straight from the study guide. She puts in effort into going over what might be on the exam. Textbooks and attendance are not required. (I mean CRJU2201 not 1101)
Made the class very fun and enjoyable to take, few quizzes and writing assignments online, and she always had really good reviews before any assignment or quiz.

I loved her, she gave little work to do outside of class. Only two quizzes but gave us everything we needed for it. She gave some lectures but they were very interesting, she's funny as well. I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Attendance is not required but very much encouraged.  There aren't required readings but supplementary ones are offered.   She is an amazing professor that cares about her students.  She has some really good stories and is personable, but also knows what she's talking about.

Attendance isn't mandatory but she doesn't have power points, so I recommend going because what she says in class is what you should write down. Most of what she teaches is also on the quizzes. We also had 4 police reports (extremely detailed) and 2 case studies. She ended up giving participation grades for only 2 of the police reports. Fun class

Dr. Combs is amazing! One of the best Criminal Justice professors available at KSU. Her Police in America class was very insightful and comprehensive. We looked at everything from the hiring process to police culture to work stress. She has a great deal of experience in the field. I highly recommend if you are interested in a career in policing!

Police in America with Dr. Combs is a must. This class gives you an inside look with real life experiences given to you by Dr. Combs herself and people she knows. Not only has she had first hand experience in field but she bring in other who also. Dr. Combs has the connections and inside look. Rate 12/10

Dr. Combs was a real gem! She made the rather dull subject of ethics very enjoyable for her students and helped us in truly understanding the material. She tried her best to apply the material to modern events and issues, and tied in many criminal justice issues that occur today. She kept the class together despite online learning and COVID.

Professor Combs was extremely caring and passionate about her students. She always looked for ways to help her students. I will be taking her again for her ethics class. That is how amazing she is. No text book required. She would always post the notes she used to give the class online, so that was really helpful when it came to taking the quizzes.
Professor Combs is amazing!!! Best professor I have ever had. Will definitely take her again if I have the opportunity. Her lectures are amazing and I love her stories. Shes the best.

Pretty easy class. Professor is a bit slow to enter grades. Like, 3 weeks behind or more. Material is pretty easy. Discussions and quizzes weekly. Frequent writing assignments. Midterm and final not proctored.

Second time taking professor Combs, she is truly my favorite professor. I love this woman, and I am so sad I will not be able to take her again in the future. You would truly be doing yourself a disservice by taking any other professor for the courses she teaches. Love Combs!
I love professor Combs, she was fabulous and hilarious. Shes everything I aspire to be.

She is a good professor, but she was a little disorganized. She would say a discussion was due at 11:59pm but it would stop letting you post at 10:00pm and her response was "you shouldn't wait till last minute to do your assignments". Mods didnt open on time and she didnt extend the time due. Good class, need your text book to pass!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I have taken her for three classes and have passed all three with an A. Shes super lenient, her notes are from the book and her tests/quizzes are only what she mentions in class. Always has guest speakers. She makes every class fun, probably the best crju teacher at Ksu.

I have taken all the criminal justice classes at ksu and she is not the easiest. I have gotten all A's in every class except hers. SHe does not teach, gives assignments with no rubric and you do NOT learn anyhthing at all. The class is not difficult but she gives quizes that are opened answered after 10 minute lecture and you will not get an A.

A quiz, group project, current event, movie assignment, and a final. Her quiz and final exam are not multiple choice and are really hard. She brings a lot of guest speakers and we go on a jail tour. She's nice and the class is fun but if you want to learn something don't take this class. She has her favorites

Super nice. Class was easy- lots of guest speakers and short, concise lectures. A little boring at times because she does play random videos instead of lectures relatively often. Lots of extra credit, test/ quizzes were easy and she prepared us very well for them.

Jen is a great professor and should be full time at KSU.  I wouldn't suggest skipping class, or coming in late, and the book is a must.  If you show up, participate and do what is expected of you there is no reason you shouldn't earn at least a B, if not an A.  If you're serious about learning then take Jen, if not then find someone else.

If you're looking for a class that won't make you sweat/cry. Here it is. She is hilarious, she rarely keeps you the entire class period, and you get to go on a jail tour. She gives a review prior to every exam (2), and the other assignments are easy. However, if you are passionate about the course and you want to learn something, then don't take it
One of the best professors I've ever had. Kennesaw State is lucky to have her as a faculty member. I really enjoyed her class and would never hesitate to sign up for anything she teaches.

Ms. Combs is the best teacher in the criminal justice department. She is hilarious and makes every lecture fun to be in! I also took her for criminal investigation and I made the best choice. Both classes were awesome and I would take her again. If you are going to take corrections or criminal investigation, take her!! She is the best!

She is the best professor on the planet, I don't think anyone or anything can surpass her. She's an expert professor and she makes you look forward to coming to every single class. I received a hundred on her first exam this semester, the study guide is the test verbatim. Remember to scribble in extra credit because she will not have a box for it.

Took teacher again! Weekly hw assignments from txtbk. 2 unit tests, 1 midterm and 1 final. The final was a presentation (mock trial) with a group. Makeup up crime/steps present to "jury". Show up for class take notes and will do well on the exams.

best teacher everrr! Interesting class, not difficult, teacher makes it fun! 2 unit tests, 1 midterm - presentation, paper and occasional fun extra credit assignments (must be in class to receive credit). Clear grading on assignments. Goes over tests/quizzes for understanding. Study for test review and will do well on the exam!

She's very clear about class subject. I was scared for the 1st test but others told me to show up for the review day &  I would be fine. I got a 94 on the test. Funny. There is 2 unit tests, 1 midterm - project, 1 paper and 1 final. Also need bk for review ?'s @ end of chapters. Some days we don't even have classAll are pretty easy. Just take notes

Very easy course. Grading is a point structure.homework for each chapter which is answering 3 chapter/review questions.2 test. Just listen to review and you will get an A/short answer style of tests. TONS of extra/credit points such as CrJu crossword puzzles. 1 APA format research paper 10 pages. Just format it right easy A. You can't fail.

The best professor I've had at KSU. Book is mandatory (weekly SHORT homework). 2 tests that are easy if you study the review. 1 simple group project. You're graded on creativity. If you do something creative (skit/video) you will get an A for sure on the project. 1 paper. Easy A if you put forth effort.

She is the best professor you will ever have, she is the bomb. I took her for corrections Fall 2013 she's helpful, nice, fair, and honest you can't go wrong. Pay attention to her test reviews and you will get an A on every test. P.S. if you have a concern talk to her she helped me find a job in my field because she has five+ she's great.

Best professor at Kennesaw State. I took Corrections with her Fall 2013. She doesn't monitor attendance. Her tests are strictly off her notes. As long as you are there for the review it should be an easy A. She also gives TONS of extra credit. She understands you have a life out of school. Super nice and well help you out as much as she can.
